intro: Bulbostylis equitans, commonly known as the narrowleaf bulbostylis, is a small, herbaceous plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, grassy leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy environments, such as swamps and seasonally flooded areas. Its flowers are inconspicuous, featuring three stamens and a three-lobed pistil. Bulbostylis equitans is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, contributing to the biodiversity of wetland ecosystems.
